cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest, then bending northwest toward the South Carolina coast with inland motion across eastern SC/NC before turning northeast and re-emerging offshore early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (between Charleston and Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, South Carolina to Cape Lookout, North Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from northern Florida through North Carolina, including the entire South Carolina shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (40–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Saturday afternoon through Sunday over the port area
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–3 ft and dangerous surf/rip currents expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible through the weekend, localized amounts near 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf likely to disrupt vessel traffic and berth operations
